prompt_for_llm.description: A web application to help users generate and publish viral LinkedIn posts based on various parameters.

ui_decription.layout: A clean, single-column layout centered on the page.
ui_decription.title: Viral LinkedIn Post Generator

output_area.name: generated_post
output_area.label: Generated LinkedIn Post
output_area.placeholder: Generated post will appear here. You can edit before publishing.

generate_post.action: Make an HTTP POST request to the generate_webhook_url.

request.body: A JSON object containing the values from the form fields: theme, post_type, length, and tone.

response.type: The response will be plain text containing the generated post.
response.action_on_success: Display the returned text in the 'Generated LinkedIn Post' textarea.

publish_post.action: Make an HTTP POST request to the publish_webhook_url.

body.post_text: The (potentially edited) content from the 'Generated LinkedIn Post' textarea.
body.metadata: An object containing the original theme, post_type, length, and tone.

response.type: A JSON object confirming the publish status.
response.action_on_success: Optionally, display a success message or the response from the API.

functionality.form_handling: The form should be validated to ensure all required fields are filled before the 'Generate Post' button is enabled.

implementation_notes: Use Angular's Reactive Forms to manage the form state.
Use Angular's HttpClient to make the POST requests to the webhooks.
Style all components using Tailwind CSS 4 utility classes.
Ensure the application is responsive and looks good on different screen sizes.
Create separate components for the form, the output area, and the main app view for better organization.
